Kopi Indonesia Terjual Laris Rp 4,5 Miliar Dalam Pameran Kopi Internasional Vietnam
03 Nov 2019, 17:14 by Retno M



Kopi Indonesia Terjual Laris Rp 4,5 Miliar Dalam Pameran Kopi Internasional Vietnam



Kopi Indonesia Terjual Laris Rp 4,5 Miliar Dalam Pameran Kopi Internasional Vietnam


KBRN, Ho Chi Minh : Konsul Jenderal RI (KJRI) Ho Chi Minh City bekerjasama dengan Atase Perdagangan KBRI Hanoi menghadirkan produk kopi Indonesia di ajang Coffee Expo Vietnam 2019 yang berlangsung di Ho Chi Minh City dari tanggal 31 Oktober - 2 November 2019. Dalam rilis yang diterima redaksi RRI, Minggu (3/11/2019), disebutkan, 7 perusahaan kopi Indonesia yang turut berpartisipasi adalah Ulubelu Coffee (Lampung), Indraco Group (Surabaya), Kopi Serboek Sari (Sumatera Barat), CV Tujuh Bintang Jaya (Yogyakarta), PT. Nabu Kopi Ranah Indonesia (Jakarta), CV Bawadi kopi (Aceh), dan Indonesia In Your Hand (Jakarta). Perusahaan yang hadir tersebut telah menjual Kopi Indonesia ke berbagai negara, termasuk CV Bawadi yang telah menjual 300 ton kopi ke Starbucks America Serikat.
Konjen RI Ho Chi Minh City, Hanif Salim menyambut antusias 7 Perusahaan kopi potensial Indonesia tersebut sambil mengingatkan kembali sejarah kopi di Vietnam bahwa prestasi Vietnam sebagai penghasil kopi nomor 2 terbesar dunia saat ini, tidak lepas dari kontribusi  keberhasilan program bantuan Indonesia kepada Vietnam sejak tahin 1986, Indonesia membantu memberikan pelatihan khusus perkebunan kopi kepada pihak Vietnam di beberapa  perkebunan kopi di Lampung Sumatera dan Jawa Timur.
"Kita harus yakin dan jangan takut bersaing, walaupun kopi Vietnam dari segi produktifitas lebih banyak dan harga lebih murah, tapi kopi Indonesia memiliki kualitas dan cita rasa luar biasa dan lebih baik" ujar Hanif Salim. "Kopi Indonesia tetap dicari pembeli di Vietnam karna kualitas yang yang sudah diakui dunia. Tahun lalu kita berhasil menjual 1 - 2 kontainer setiap bulan Kopi Gayo pada ajang Vietnam Coffee Show 2018" tambah Hanif Salim.
Kepada peserta pameran juga diharapkan dapat menampilkan berbagai prestasi yang telah diraih kopi Indonesia dalam kompetisi kopi International. "Info ini wajib kita tonjolkan saat pameran karena memiliki nilai strategis dan membantu meyakinkan pembeli kopi Indonesia ini  penting kita tonjolkan dalam setiap kegiatan promosi kopi Indonesia sehingga strategi ini turut menunjang terjualnya kopi dalan jumlah besar kepada pelanggan" tegas Hanif Salim.
Rinaldi Hartono, Operation Manager, Ulubelu Coffee, perusahaan kopi-nya  membina lebih lebih dari 2000 petani kopi Lampung, sangat setuju dengan strategi yg disampaikan Hanif Salim. Sebagai salah satu kunci keberhasilan dalam marketing saat pameran Robusta Trader Rinaldi berani menjamin bahwa kualitas dan cita rasa kopi Indonesia diminati di pasar Vietnam dan dunia.
"Walaupun dari sisi harga, sedikit lebih mahal dari Vietnam, namun Kopi Indonesia mampu bersaing di pasar global" ujar Rinaldi. "Baru-baru ini, Kopi Robusta Honey Ulubele meraih penghargaan Gold Medal pada International Contest AVPA 2019 di Paris. Kopi Indonesia juga pernah juara di New York USA. Hal ini membuktikan keunggulan kualitas kopi Indonesia" tambah Rinaldi.
Ulubelu Coffee pada pameran ini berhasil mendapatkan penjualan awal senilai Rp. 841 juta. Jika ditambahkan dengan penjualan perusahaan Indonesia lainnya, maka total potensi penjualan selama pameran mencapai Rp. 4,5 milyar.
Mengingat kualitas kopi Indonesia yg tinggi, sebagian besar kopi Indonesia yang diimpor ke Vietnam tersebut digunakan sebagai bahan campuran dengan kopi lokal untuk memperkuat cita rasa kopi lokal sebelum dijual ke konsumen.
Selain Indonesia, Coffee Expo Vietnam 2019 diikuti oleh 8 negara lainnya yaitu Korea Selatan, Singapore, Taiwan, China, Malaysia, Myanmar, Colombia dan Kamboja.

Indonesian Coffee Selling Best Rp. 4.5 Billion in Vietnam International Coffee Exhibition
Nov 03 2019, 17:14 by Retno M



Indonesian Coffee Selling Best Rp. 4.5 Billion in Vietnam International Coffee Exhibition



Indonesian Coffee Selling Best Rp. 4.5 Billion in Vietnam International Coffee Exhibition


KBRN, Ho Chi Minh: Consul General of the Republic of Indonesia (KJRI) Ho Chi Minh City in collaboration with the Trade Attache of the Indonesian Embassy in Hanoi presented Indonesian coffee products at the Vietnam Coffee Expo 2019 which took place in Ho Chi Minh City from 31 October - 2 November 2019. In release received by the RRI editorial on Sunday (11/3/2019), mentioned, 7 Indonesian coffee companies that participated were Ulubelu Coffee (Lampung), Indraco Group (Surabaya), Serboek Sari Coffee (West Sumatra), CV. Seven Bintang Jaya (Yogyakarta ), PT. Nabu Kopi Ranah Indonesia (Jakarta), CV Bawadi Kopi (Aceh), and Indonesia In Your Hand (Jakarta). The company that attended sold Indonesian Coffee to various countries, including CV Bawadi, which had sold 300 tons of coffee to Starbucks America.
Indonesian Consul General Ho Chi Minh City, Hanif Salim enthusiastically welcomed the 7 potential Indonesian coffee companies while recalling the history of coffee in Vietnam that Vietnam's achievement as the world's second largest coffee producer today cannot be separated from the successful contribution of Indonesia's aid program to Vietnam since 1986 , Indonesia helped provide specialized coffee plantations training to the Vietnamese in several coffee plantations in Lampung, Sumatra and East Java.
"We have to be sure and don't be afraid to compete, even though Vietnamese coffee in terms of more productivity and lower prices, Indonesian coffee has exceptional and better quality and taste," Hanif Salim said. "Indonesian coffee is still sought by buyers in Vietnam because of the quality that has been recognized by the world. Last year we managed to sell 1-2 containers every month Gayo Coffee at the 2018 Vietnam Coffee Show" added Hanif Salim.
The exhibitors are also expected to be able to display various achievements that have been achieved by Indonesian coffee in international coffee competitions. "We must highlight this information during the exhibition because it has strategic value and helps convince Indonesian coffee buyers. It is important that we highlight it in every promotional activity of Indonesian coffee so that this strategy also supports the sale of large quantities of coffee to customers," Hanif Salim stressed.
Rinaldi Hartono, Operations Manager, Ulubelu Coffee, his coffee company fostered more than 2000 Lampung coffee farmers, strongly agreed with the strategy presented by Hanif Salim. As one of the keys to success in marketing when the Robusta Trader Rinaldi exhibition dares to guarantee that the quality and taste of Indonesian coffee is in demand in the Vietnam and world markets.
"Although in terms of price, it is slightly more expensive than Vietnam, but Indonesian coffee is able to compete in the global market," said Rinaldi. "Recently, Robusta Honey Ulubele Coffee won the Gold Medal award at the 2019 AVPA International Contest in Paris. Indonesian coffee has also won in New York USA. This proves the superior quality of Indonesian coffee" added Rinaldi.
Ulubelu Coffee at this exhibition managed to get an initial sale of Rp. 841 million. If added to the sales of other Indonesian companies, the total potential sales during the exhibition will reach Rp. 4.5 billion.
Considering the high quality of Indonesian coffee, most of the Indonesian coffee imported into Vietnam is used as a mixture with local coffee to strengthen the taste of local coffee before it is sold to consumers.
Besides Indonesia, the 2019 Vietnam Coffee Expo was joined by 8 other countries, namely South Korea, Singapore, Taiwan, China, Malaysia, Myanmar, Colombia and Cambodia.
